intro: Phaca andicola, commonly known as the Andean phaca, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage is often hairy, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Phaca andicola is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
